content:
published  September  

SANTO DOMINGO Dominican Republic AP  With scores dead and hundreds missing Dominicans grieved at packed churches and searched for drinkable water on Thursday throughout the hurricanebattered country PERIOD
Frantic searches continued for the missing including  people who disappeared when floods swept away a shelter in San Cristobal PERIOD
As the hurricane headed for the Florida Keys bad news kept coming from throughout the Caribbean  dead in Haiti  billion in damage and hundreds of homes lost in Puerto Rico three dead and two missing in St PERIOD Kitts two killed in Cuba PERIOD
Everywhere storm victims struggled to find water food ice and other bare essentials to cope with loss and the tropical heat PERIOD
In the Domincan Republic Thursday was the day of the countrys patron saint Virgen Mercedes PERIOD Residents crammed churches to pray for hurricane victims PERIOD
President Leonel Fernandez announced Wednesday that  Dominicans had died and hundreds were still missing since Georges  mph winds swept through this impoverished Caribbean nation on Tuesday PERIOD
The hurricane struck southern Cuba on Wednesday crossed it and was moving off its northern coast Thursday afternoon threatening the Florida Keys PERIOD
